comments.html: And thoughts about implementing QoS on a DMVPN network? It gets quite complicated on dual hub single cloud DMVPN...
comments.name: Sinisa

comments.html: The hub side is a bit better with the new NHRP-based QoS (official name: per-tunnel QoS), the spoke side is still quite funky, more so in Phase 2 DMVPN.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
Ivan,
Have you given any thought on how this would work in an ASA environment, especially since it does not support DMVPN natively. Most of the solutions I've seen involve throwing routers infront/behind the ASA.
comments.name: Mike King

comments.html: Where exactly would you place ASA's and routers on hub and spoke sites?
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: Unfortunately, I inherited this design and equipment, so your "step back" really struck a chord.  It's all ASA's.  5550's at the two datacenters, and 5505's at the (7) remote sites.  Currently it's just an ASA at the border, with a switch connected to the inside interface.  Each remote site ASA has a private network link to the datacenter, with a commodity internet backup.
comments.name: Mike King
